submission:
class Solution:
    def numberOfSubstrings(self, s: str) -> int:
        z = []
        for i, c in enumerate(s):
            if c == '0': z.append(i)
        
        n = len(s)
        last = n
        m = [0] * n
        for i in range(n - 1, -1, -1):
            m[i] = last
            if s[i] == '0': last = i
        
        ans = 0
        
#         print(z)
#         print(m)
        
        for i in range(n):
            p = 0 # 0
            one = 0 # 1
            if s[i] == '1':
                ans += m[i] - i
                one = m[i] - i
            else:
                ans += m[i] - i - 1
                one = m[i] - i - 1
                p = 1
            
            # print(ans, one, p)
            
            curr = m[i]
            q = 0
            while curr < n and q < 201:
                q += 1
                p += 1
                temp = m[curr] - curr - 1
                
                if temp + one < p * p:
                    # print('====1')
                    one += temp
                elif one >= p * p:
                    # print('====2')
                    
                    one += temp
                    ans += temp + 1
                else:
                    # print('====3')
                    
                    ans += temp + one - p * p + 1
                    one += temp
                curr = m[curr]
                
            #     print(q, "zero = ", p, "one = ", one, "curr = ", one, "curr = ", curr, "ans = ", ans)
            # print(i, s[i], ans)
        
        return ans
